meanings.sent1: She was unhooding the jacket to feel the cool breeze.
meanings.sent2: The detective unhooded the suspect to identify him.
meanings.sent3: The magician unhooded the rabbit, revealing its fluffy white fur.
meanings.sent4: As the clouds parted, the sun unhooded its bright rays upon the valley.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unhooded the falcon, setting it free into the sky.

meanings.definition: To reveal or expose something hidden or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The artist was unhooding his masterpiece for the art show.
meanings.sent2: The journalist unhooded the corruption scandal, shocking the public.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was ruined when the birthday girl accidentally unhooded the decorations.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise unhooded the beauty of the landscape, painting it in golden light.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map unhooded the location of the hidden chest, buried deep in the sand.
